p: Health inequities occur where there are preventable differences between groups in access to services and resources that improve health outcomes [ 4]. Women are demonstrably subject to health inequities with regard to access to harm reduction services. Despite a clear need for harm reduction services for women, they continue to be dominated by “masculinist” concerns and do not meet women’s needs [ 5], and the literature indicates that women who use drugs are rarely adequately represented in design and evaluation of harm reduction services [ 6– 8].
